clinical_study.brief_title: Monitoring ANS Activity by Utilization of the Combined Physiological Activity Index (CPAI)
clinical_study.official_title: Monitoring Autonomic Nervous System Activity Using Non-invasive Physiological Measurement by Utilization of the Combined Physiological Activity Index (CPAI)

brief_summary.textblock: A clinical trial to validate the MCPM (Multi-parameter Combined Physiological Signal-based Monitoring), in estimating autonomic nervous system activity level, at rest and while exposed to noxious stimuli.

detailed_description.textblock:
The MCPM system acquires physiological signals and calculates the physiological parameters. The relationship between these parameter forms the basis for the system mechanism of operation, which non-linearly combines inputs from the individual parameters into a measurable index (the CPAI) that represents an integrated measure of patient's physiological changes.
Subjects who meet the study inclusion and exclusion criteria will be enrolled to the study and their physiological measures, at rest and during exposure to the noxious stimuli will be recorded by the MCPM and the ProComp system. All subjects will be recorded according to a standard procedure; subjects will be lying in the supine position and will be instructed to avoid any movements. The experimenter will connect the sensors (MCPM finger probe, the ProComp device). During the experimental session, different noxious stimuli will be administrated via the cold pressor test, with intervals of rest between stimuli. The last stimuli is an exercise preformed by the subject. One week after the first visit, about half of the subjects will be invited to a second visit, identical study visit, to assess the between session test-retest reliability of the signals. Moreover, in this additional session, a repeated stimuli will be added.

primary_outcome.description: differentiation between periods in which the subjects were exposed to various intensities of noxious stimuli.

secondary_outcome.measure: Accuracy of the physiological parameters of the MCPM
secondary_outcome.description: comparison to a gold standard device (GE system)
comparison of two repeated CPAI and physiological parameters measures of the same individual at two different study visits

arm_group.description: Asymptomatic subjects receiving noxious stimuli (thermal stimuli and muscle stimuli) at rest, and being monitored MCPM.

intervention.description: Multi-parameter Combined Physiological Signal-based Monitoring, a non-invasive system designed to provide real-time information about physiological changes
Cold stimuli administrated via the cold pressor test
An exercise stimulating the muscles done by subject

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age > 18 < 65 years old
- Signing an Informed Consent Form (ICF)
- Healthy participant
- No medication/drugs were taken in the last week
- No usage of chronic medication in the last 3 months (except non-pregnancy pills)
- Blood Pressure < (90,140), Heart Rate < 100pps at rest
- No alcohol usage during the last 48 hours
Exclusion Criteria:
- Medication/drugs were taken in the last week (not including non-pregnancy pills)
- Alcohol usage during the last 48 hours
- Caffeine and smoking in the last 3 hours
- Pregnant women
- Inability to comply with the study protocol
